dsl_rule: ASSOCIATED(field1, field2, 'Each CSI Resource Setting is located in the DL BWP identified by the higher layer parameter BWP-id')
predicate: The BWP-id in bwp-dedicated_pdsch-config is associated with the csi-rs-resourcesetlist in csi-measconfig_csi-resourceconfigtoaddmodlist, as each CSI Resource Setting is located in the DL BWP identified by the higher layer parameter BWP-id.

valid: bwp-id: 1, csi-rs-resourcesetlist: {CSI Resource Setting located in DL BWP identified by BWP-id 1}
invalid: bwp-id: 1, csi-rs-resourcesetlist: {CSI Resource Setting located in DL BWP identified by BWP-id 2}

notes: The association is based on the location of the CSI Resource Setting in the DL BWP identified by the BWP-id.

meta.evidence: Each CSI Resource Setting CSI-ResourceConfig contains a configuration of a list of S \( \geq 1 \) CSI Resource Sets (given by higher layer parameter csi-RS-ResourceSetList), where the list is comprised of references to either or both of NZP CSIRS resource set(s) and SS/PBCH block set(s) or the list is comprised of references to CSI-[M resource set(s). Each CSI Resource Setting is located in the DL BWP identified by the higher layer parameter BWP-id, and all CSI Resource Settings linked to a CSI Report Setting have the same DL BWP.

full_api_response.dsl: ASSOCIATED(field1, field2, 'Each CSI Resource Setting is located in the DL BWP identified by the higher layer parameter BWP-id')
full_api_response.predicate: The BWP-id in bwp-dedicated_pdsch-config is associated with the csi-rs-resourcesetlist in csi-measconfig_csi-resourceconfigtoaddmodlist, as each CSI Resource Setting is located in the DL BWP identified by the higher layer parameter BWP-id.

valid: bwp-id: 1, csi-rs-resourcesetlist: {CSI Resource Setting located in DL BWP identified by BWP-id 1}
invalid: bwp-id: 1, csi-rs-resourcesetlist: {CSI Resource Setting located in DL BWP identified by BWP-id 2}

full_api_response.notes: The association is based on the location of the CSI Resource Setting in the DL BWP identified by the BWP-id.
